a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income inequality: Gini coefficient in Latin America (after tax), 1981 to
The Gini coefficient measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality. Inequality is
measured here in terms of income after taxes and benefits.
Data source: Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean (CEDLAS and The World Bank)
